problem.p: A uniform square plate ABCD has mass $m kg and side length $d m. The square is pivoted at vertex D and held at rest so that sides AB and CD are horizontal (see the diagram). Initially, the plate is held at rest. After it is released, the plate swings downward, rotating about the pivot point. Resistive force can be neglected. The acceleration due to gravity is g = 9.8 m/s2. The rotational inertia of a square plate relative to the axis perpendicular to the plate and passing through the center of mass is \(m d^2/6\).
